trans-unit.source: IIS Authentication and Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: IIS Authentication and Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: This is the Azure Multi-factor authentication page that will assist in deploying IIS Authentication and Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server.
trans-unit.target: This is the Azure Multi-factor authentication page that will assist in deploying IIS Authentication and Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server.

trans-unit.source: IIS Authentication
trans-unit.target: IIS Authentication

trans-unit.source: The IIS Authentication section of the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server allows you to enable and configure IIS authentication for integration with Microsoft IIS web applications.
trans-unit.target: The IIS Authentication section of the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server allows you to enable and configure IIS authentication for integration with Microsoft IIS web applications.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server installs a plug-in which can filter requests being made to the IIS web server in order to add Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server installs a plug-in which can filter requests being made to the IIS web server in order to add Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: The IIS plug-in provides support for Form-Based Authentication and Integrated Windows HTTP Authentication.
trans-unit.target: The IIS plug-in provides support for Form-Based Authentication and Integrated Windows HTTP Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Trusted IPs can also be configured to exempt internal IP addresses from two-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Trusted IPs can also be configured to exempt internal IP addresses from two-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: IIS Authentication
trans-unit.target: IIS Authentication

trans-unit.source: Using Form-Based IIS Authentication with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Using Form-Based IIS Authentication with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: To secure an IIS web application that uses form-based authentication, install the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server on the IIS web server and configure the Server per the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: To secure an IIS web application that uses form-based authentication, install the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server on the IIS web server and configure the Server per the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: Within the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server click the IIS Authentication icon in the left menu.
trans-unit.target: Within the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server click the IIS Authentication icon in the left menu.

trans-unit.source: Click the Form-Based tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Form-Based tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the Add…
trans-unit.target: Click the Add…

trans-unit.source: button.
trans-unit.target: button.

trans-unit.source: To detect username, password and domain variables automatically, enter the Login URL (e.g. https://localhost/contoso/auth/login.aspx) within the Auto-Configure Form-Based Website dialog box and click OK.
trans-unit.target: To detect username, password and domain variables automatically, enter the Login URL (e.g. https://localhost/contoso/auth/login.aspx) within the Auto-Configure Form-Based Website dialog box and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Check the Require Multi-Factor Authentication user match box if all users have been or will be imported into the Server and subject to multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Check the Require Multi-Factor Authentication user match box if all users have been or will be imported into the Server and subject to multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: If a significant number of users have not yet been imported into the Server and/or will be exempt from multi-factor authentication, leave the box unchecked.
trans-unit.target: If a significant number of users have not yet been imported into the Server and/or will be exempt from multi-factor authentication, leave the box unchecked.

trans-unit.source: If the page variables cannot be detected automatically, click the Specify Manually…
trans-unit.target: If the page variables cannot be detected automatically, click the Specify Manually…

trans-unit.source: button in the Auto-Configure Form-Based Website dialog box.
trans-unit.target: button in the Auto-Configure Form-Based Website dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Form-Based Website dialog box, enter the URL to the login page in the Submit URL field and enter an Application name (optional).
trans-unit.target: In the Add Form-Based Website dialog box, enter the URL to the login page in the Submit URL field and enter an Application name (optional).

trans-unit.source: The Application name appears in Azure Multi-Factor Authentication reports and may be displayed within SMS or Mobile App authentication messages.
trans-unit.target: The Application name appears in Azure Multi-Factor Authentication reports and may be displayed within SMS or Mobile App authentication messages.

trans-unit.source: See the help file for more information on the Submit URL.
trans-unit.target: See the help file for more information on the Submit URL.

trans-unit.source: Select the correct Request format.
trans-unit.target: Select the correct Request format.

trans-unit.source: This is set to “POST or GET” for most web applications.
trans-unit.target: This is set to “POST or GET” for most web applications.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Username variable, Password variable and Domain variable (if it appears on the login page).
trans-unit.target: Enter the Username variable, Password variable and Domain variable (if it appears on the login page).

trans-unit.source: You may need to navigate to the login page in a web browser, right-click on the page and select “View Source” to find the names of the input boxes within the page.
trans-unit.target: You may need to navigate to the login page in a web browser, right-click on the page and select “View Source” to find the names of the input boxes within the page.

trans-unit.source: Check the Require Azure Multi-Factor Authentication user match box if all users have been or will be imported into the Server and subject to multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Check the Require Azure Multi-Factor Authentication user match box if all users have been or will be imported into the Server and subject to multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: If a significant number of users have not yet been imported into the Server and/or will be exempt from multi-factor authentication, leave the box unchecked.
trans-unit.target: If a significant number of users have not yet been imported into the Server and/or will be exempt from multi-factor authentication, leave the box unchecked.

trans-unit.source: See the help file for additional information on this feature.
trans-unit.target: See the help file for additional information on this feature.

trans-unit.source: Click the Advanced…
trans-unit.target: Click the Advanced…

trans-unit.source: button to review advanced settings, including the ability to select a custom denial page file, to cache successful authentications to the website for a period of time using cookies and to select whether to authenticate the primary credentials against the Windows Domain, an LDAP directory or a RADIUS server.
trans-unit.target: button to review advanced settings, including the ability to select a custom denial page file, to cache successful authentications to the website for a period of time using cookies and to select whether to authenticate the primary credentials against the Windows Domain, an LDAP directory or a RADIUS server.

trans-unit.source: When complete click the OK button to return to the Add Form-Based Website dialog box.
trans-unit.target: When complete click the OK button to return to the Add Form-Based Website dialog box.

trans-unit.source: See the help file for more information on the advanced settings.
trans-unit.target: See the help file for more information on the advanced settings.

trans-unit.source: Click the OK button.
trans-unit.target: Click the OK button.

trans-unit.source: Once the URL and page variables have been detected or entered, the website data will display in the Form-Based panel.
trans-unit.target: Once the URL and page variables have been detected or entered, the website data will display in the Form-Based panel.

trans-unit.source: See the Enable IIS Plug-ins for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server section directly below to complete the IIS authentication configuration.
trans-unit.target: See the Enable IIS Plug-ins for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server section directly below to complete the IIS authentication configuration.

trans-unit.source: Using Integrated Windows Authentication with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Using Integrated Windows Authentication with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: To secure an IIS web application that uses Integrated Windows HTTP authentication, install the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server on the IIS web server and configure the Server per the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: To secure an IIS web application that uses Integrated Windows HTTP authentication, install the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server on the IIS web server and configure the Server per the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: Within the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server click the IIS Authentication icon in the left menu.
trans-unit.target: Within the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server click the IIS Authentication icon in the left menu.

trans-unit.source: Click the HTTP tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the HTTP tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the Form-Based tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Form-Based tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the Add…
trans-unit.target: Click the Add…

trans-unit.source: button.
trans-unit.target: button.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Base URL dialogue box, enter the URL for the website where HTTP authentication is performed (e.g. http://localhost/owa) into the Base URL field and enter an Application name (optional).
trans-unit.target: In the Add Base URL dialogue box, enter the URL for the website where HTTP authentication is performed (e.g. http://localhost/owa) into the Base URL field and enter an Application name (optional).

trans-unit.source: The Application name appears in Azure Multi-Factor Authentication reports and may be displayed within SMS or Mobile App authentication messages.
trans-unit.target: The Application name appears in Azure Multi-Factor Authentication reports and may be displayed within SMS or Mobile App authentication messages.

trans-unit.source: Adjust the Idle timeout and Maximum session times if the default is not sufficient.
trans-unit.target: Adjust the Idle timeout and Maximum session times if the default is not sufficient.

trans-unit.source: Check the Require Multi-Factor Authentication user match box if all users have been or will be imported into the Server and subject to multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Check the Require Multi-Factor Authentication user match box if all users have been or will be imported into the Server and subject to multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: If a significant number of users have not yet been imported into the Server and/or will be exempt from multi-factor authentication, leave the box unchecked.
trans-unit.target: If a significant number of users have not yet been imported into the Server and/or will be exempt from multi-factor authentication, leave the box unchecked.

trans-unit.source: See the help file for additional information on this feature.
trans-unit.target: See the help file for additional information on this feature.

trans-unit.source: Check the cookie cache box if desired.
trans-unit.target: Check the cookie cache box if desired.

trans-unit.source: Click the OK button.
trans-unit.target: Click the OK button.

trans-unit.source: See the [Enable IIS Plug-ins for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server](#enable-iis-plug-ins-for-azure-multi-factor-authentication-server) section directly below to complete the IIS authentication configuration.
trans-unit.target: See the [Enable IIS Plug-ins for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server](#enable-iis-plug-ins-for-azure-multi-factor-authentication-server) section directly below to complete the IIS authentication configuration.

trans-unit.source: Enable IIS Plug-ins for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Enable IIS Plug-ins for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: Once you have configured the Form-Based or HTTP authentication URLs and settings, you must select the locations where the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication IIS plug-ins should be loaded and enabled in IIS.
trans-unit.target: Once you have configured the Form-Based or HTTP authentication URLs and settings, you must select the locations where the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication IIS plug-ins should be loaded and enabled in IIS.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure:
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure:

trans-unit.source: If running on IIS 6, click the ISAPI tab and select the website that the web application is running under (e.g. Default Web Site) to enable the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication ISAPI filter plug-in for that site.
trans-unit.target: If running on IIS 6, click the ISAPI tab and select the website that the web application is running under (e.g. Default Web Site) to enable the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication ISAPI filter plug-in for that site.

trans-unit.source: If running on IIS 7 or higher, click the Native Module tab and select the server, website(s) or application(s) to enable the IIS plug-in at the desired level(s).
trans-unit.target: If running on IIS 7 or higher, click the Native Module tab and select the server, website(s) or application(s) to enable the IIS plug-in at the desired level(s).

trans-unit.source: Click the Enable IIS authentication box at the top of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Click the Enable IIS authentication box at the top of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication is now securing the selected IIS application.
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication is now securing the selected IIS application.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that users have been imported into the Server.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that users have been imported into the Server.

trans-unit.source: See the Trusted IPs section below if you would like to whitelist internal IP addresses so that two- factor authentication is not required when logging into the website from those locations.
trans-unit.target: See the Trusted IPs section below if you would like to whitelist internal IP addresses so that two- factor authentication is not required when logging into the website from those locations.

trans-unit.source: Trusted IPs
trans-unit.target: Trusted IPs

trans-unit.source: The Trusted IPs allows users to bypass Azure Multi-Factor Authentication for website requests originating from specific IP addresses or subnets.
trans-unit.target: The Trusted IPs allows users to bypass Azure Multi-Factor Authentication for website requests originating from specific IP addresses or subnets.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may want to exempt users from Azure Multi-Factor Authentication while logging in from the office.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may want to exempt users from Azure Multi-Factor Authentication while logging in from the office.

trans-unit.source: For this, you would specify the office subnet as an Trusted IPs entry.
trans-unit.target: For this, you would specify the office subnet as an Trusted IPs entry.

trans-unit.source: To configure Trusted IPs use the following procedure:
trans-unit.target: To configure Trusted IPs use the following procedure:

trans-unit.source: In the IIS Authentication section, click the Trusted IPs tab.
trans-unit.target: In the IIS Authentication section, click the Trusted IPs tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the Add…
trans-unit.target: Click the Add…

trans-unit.source: button.
trans-unit.target: button.

trans-unit.source: When the Add Trusted IPs dialog box appears, select the Single IP, IP range or Subnet radio button.
trans-unit.target: When the Add Trusted IPs dialog box appears, select the Single IP, IP range or Subnet radio button.

trans-unit.source: nter the IP address, range of IP addresses or subnet that should be whitelisted.
trans-unit.target: nter the IP address, range of IP addresses or subnet that should be whitelisted.

trans-unit.source: If entering a subnet, select the appropriate Netmask and click the OK button.
trans-unit.target: If entering a subnet, select the appropriate Netmask and click the OK button.

trans-unit.source: The whitelist has now been added.
trans-unit.target: The whitelist has now been added.
